title: Album Page, "Elevation of Two Columns, Possibly from Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 127; bottom right corner: 120; below right of drawing: San Zeno / Verona.
dimensions: Sheet: 31.4 x 21 cm (12 3/8 x 8 1/4 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet illustrating two columns, possibly the same one but seen from a different side so as to indicate the carving composition on the opposite side of the capital.  The column at left has a cuboidal capital supporting a large cushion-like cap.  The capital at right is similar in its shape but has a faintly carved profile of a leaf at either corner and a small rosette in the upper center.  The dimensions of the columns at various heights has been inscribed.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation of Two Columns, Possibly from Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-296.
